The name and nodeType fields are mandatory. For example, to create a folder:
```JSON
{
 "name":"My Folder",
 "nodeType":"cm:folder"
}
```

An empty file can be created using JSON as follows:
```JSON
{
 "name":"My text file.txt",
 "nodeType":"cm:content",
 "content": 
 {
 "mimeType":"text/plain"
 }
}
```
The binary content can then be updated using the PUT /nodes/{nodeId} endpoint.

You can also optionally create a folder (or other node) under a folder hierarchy:
```JSON
{
 "name":"My Special Folder",
 "nodeType":"cm:folder",
 "relativePath":"X/Y/Z"
}
```
The value of the relativePath (e.g. "X/Y/Z") specifies the folder structure to be 
used beneath the node, referenced by the **nodeId**. Therefore, any folders in the 
relativePath that do not exist, are created before the node is created.

You can also set properties when creating a new node:
```JSON
{
 "name":"My Other Folder",
 "nodeType":"cm:folder",
 "properties":
 {
 "cm:title":"Folder title",
 "cm:description":"This is an important folder"
 }
}
```
Any missing aspects will be auto-applied, eg. "cm:titled" in the example above. Aspects can
also be explicitly set, if needed, via an "aspectNames" field.

This endpoint also supports a file being uploaded using multipart/form-data. 

A **filedata** field is required that represents the content to upload, a **filename** field can be
used to provide an alternative name for the new file.

An **overwrite** field can be used to overwrite an existing file (by matching name). If the file is versionable
the existing content will be replaced.

When overwriting existing content the **majorVersion** boolean field can be used to indicate whether a major version 
(default is false) should be created. This will also enable versioning of this node, if not already versioned.

When overwriting existing content the **comment** field can be used to add a version comment that will appear in 
version history. This will also enable versioning of this node, if not already versioned.

An **autoRename** boolean field can also be provided. If true, then on a name clash will try to auto rename by 
finding a unique name based on an integer suffix.

Any field in the JSON body defined below can also be passed as a form-data field.
